alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:20AM EST until December 20 at 4:45AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Jersey... Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes affecting Morris, Bergen, and Passaic Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Pompton Lakes...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River at Pompton Lakes. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Nuisance, low lying flooding, occurs near the dam in the Pompton Lakes. At 11.5 feet, South section of Pompton Lakes experiences flooding. At 12.5 feet, Several residences in Pompton Lakes, along Riveredge Drive, take on water. At 13.5 feet, Hamburg Turnpike is closed between Route 202 and Riverview Road. Many residences are flooded south of Dawes Highway. At 14.5 feet, Major flooding with evacuations. Flooding worsened by the confluence of the Pompton River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Monday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.8 feet on 04/17/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Ramapo River Pompton Lakes 11.5 14.0 Mon 10 a 13.1 10.1 15.1 7pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
